byline.contributor: Victor Mather and Sam Dolnick contributed reporting.

abstract: French language is scarcely used at Rio Olympics, despite its designation in Olympic charter as one of two official languages for Games; International Organization of la Francophonie faces uphill battle in monitoring and advocating for use of language, especially when Games are held in non-French-speaking countries.
lead_paragraph: A group is determined to make sure nobody forgets that French is one of the Olympics’ two official languages, along with English.
snippet: A group is determined to make sure nobody forgets that French is one of the Olympics’ two official languages, along with English....

headline.main: Brazilians Speak Portuguese, but the Olympics Must Use French
headline.print_headline: Brazilians Speak Portuguese,  but Games Are Tied to French
